title: 70's(i think...maybe 60's) typeface...
content:
I’m sure it’s one i should already know...but what’s this typeface called?  
 [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~janetmck/bookaweek/books\_pics/overtoy...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~janetmck/bookaweek/books_pics/overtoyou.jpg "http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~janetmck/bookaweek/books\_pics/overtoyou.jpg")

thanks in advance

 [‹ Live Nation font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46134 "Go to previous forum topic") [Script on the cover of Ashanti's \_The Declaration\_ ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46176 "Go to next forum topic")
author: geth

comments.content:
[Bookman JF](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=bookman%20swash&producttype=TYP&pricemodel=RM%2CRF) on Veer, by [Jukebox](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.jawarts.com/Fonts.htm)

I think there are others, though this one for me hits the note.

Also the OpenType release of [ITC Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_bookman_1_std_virtual/) which contains all the regular caps and [swashes](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830095234/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_bookman_std_light/?acs=1&acs_ss=8&sample_text=See%20swashes%20below.) in one font.

Brilliant! ITC Bookman Std Light is exactly what i needed!

thanks to you both
